summary: Email chain between prosecutors and law enforcement regarding defense counsel's request to review evidence in the US v. Maxwell case, including highly confidential nude/partially nude images and physical evidence. The correspondence details logistical arrangements for evidence review and technical questions about image formats and metadata.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who sends the initial request to view evidence and highly confidential materials on behalf of the defense team.

persons.name: Jeff Paluca
persons.context: Copied on the email from Laura Menninger, indicating he is part of Maxwell's defense legal team.

persons.name: Christian R Everdell
persons.context: Copied on the email from Laura Menninger, indicating he is part of Maxwell's defense legal team from Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Copied on the email from Laura Menninger, indicating she is part of Maxwell's defense legal team.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in case 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), whose defense team is requesting access to evidence for review.

connections.description: Menninger is acting as defense counsel for Maxwell, making formal requests to view evidence on her behalf.
Paluca is copied on defense correspondence, indicating he is part of Maxwell's legal team.
Everdell is copied on defense correspondence, indicating he is part of Maxwell's legal team.
Sternheim is copied on defense correspondence, indicating she is part of Maxwell's legal team.

events.title: Defense Request to View Evidence
events.description: Laura Menninger sends initial request on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team to view highly confidential materials and physical evidence.

events.title: Follow-up Call with Defense Counsel
events.description: Prosecutors have a call with defense counsel who ask detailed questions about evidence format, metadata, and logistics for review.

keyFacts: The defense team requested access to approximately 2,100 images/videos from devices plus 3,459 images from discs, with a small number of nude images from the hard copy FBI Florida file.
Highly confidential nude/partially nude images were seized from Epstein's NY and USVI residences and from Epstein's devices.
The FBI maintains physical evidence from both the Florida case and the NY case, with items stored in a vault in the Bronx.

Defense counsel requested multiple laptops for evidence review due to having a team of lawyers, the defendant, and investigators, but only one drive could be provided as duplicates cannot be made of obscene material.
The FBI requires two weeks' advance notice to pull all physical evidence items from the case for defense review at their warehouse.
